title: Widen the Main Gate?
vignette: Engineers propose enlarging the main entrance of a heritage conference centre to improve wheelchair and equipment access.

options.text: Keep original measurements to preserve tradition.
Approve the change for practical benefit.

title: Add an Extra Stairwell?
vignette: Safety consultants recommend installing a second staircase in the central atrium to ease emergency evacuation flows.

options.text: Add it if it helps avoid accidents.
Do not alter the historic design.

title: Changing courtyard floor material
vignette: Replacing worn stones with modern tiles seems appealing.

options.text: Use modern materials for durability.
Retain original stones despite wear.

title: Install Seating in the Grand Hall?
vignette: Guests at major festivals complain of fatigue from standing through lengthy programmes in the venue's central hall.

options.text: Install seating for public comfort.
Leave area clear to respect the historic space.

title: Keep Walls Tall or Lower for Views?
vignette: Event planners want to shorten interior barrier-walls so visitors can see activities inside; security staff prefer the current height.

options.text: Keep them tall for privacy and security.
Lower them to engage the crowds more.

title: Widening the designated section
vignette: During gatherings a designated section becomes overcrowded.

options.text: Expand it to accommodate everyone.
Maintain historic boundaries despite discomfort.

title: Shortcut Through Restricted Zone?
vignette: Logistics staff ask to walk supplies through a restricted wing to save time during large events.

options.text: Prohibit shortcuts out of respect.
Allow if done quietly and quickly.

title: Leave Tools Overnight?
vignette: Construction crews want permission to store power tools inside the landmark overnight for next-day work efficiency.

options.text: Remove them daily to avoid security risks.
Permit storage to streamline work.

title: Using modern lighting in central complex halls
vignette: Electric lighting could help with nighttime ceremonies.

options.text: Install to ensure safety and clarity.
Stick with traditional lighting methods.

title: Artwork in the Foyer?
vignette: Local artists offer to paint inspirational murals in the main foyer; some leaders worry images will distract from the venue's purpose.

options.text: Allow tasteful artwork to beautify the complex.
Avoid images to keep focus on the venue's primary purpose.

title: More Storage Rooms?
vignette: Facility managers request two additional storage rooms to avoid clutter and lost inventory.

options.text: Build more rooms for efficiency.
Keep the structure unchanged.

title: Raising the main platform height
vignette: Some believe a taller main platform would enhance visibility.

options.text: Elevate it to improve sightlines.
Leave height as inherited from ancestors.

title: Private Entrance for VIPs?
vignette: Senior officials request a dedicated side gate for formal arrivals; some staff say all visitors should use the same doors.

options.text: Provide it to honour them.
Use the same gates to promote equality.

title: Way-finding Signs?
vignette: Visitors often get lost in the vast complex. Should management post map signs, or rely on ushers without altering walls?

options.text: Post signs to guide them.
Rely on guides without altering walls.

title: Closing unused passageways
vignette: Some doorways are rarely used and require upkeep.

options.text: Seal them to save resources.
Keep them open as part of the historic plan.
